page.title: 01Onecote and Butterton area
page.content: This area is just in the Peak District National Park and is a beautiful area attracting tourists, mainly daytrippers. The area is a designated low flying area, and visitors may be surprised by low-flying planes flying quickly and noisily overhead, but the residents become used to them. There are two villages in the area - Onecote, with the River Hamps flowing through it is on the Cheadle to Buxton road and Butterton, a quiet village with the Hoo Brook running through it, creating a ford. There is a small piece of land on Grindon Moor which is owned by the National Trust and is preserved as heather moorland. Most of the housing in the area is built of local stone, either sandstone or limestone.
